Targeter: Target Variable Profiling

Source: R/targeter.R
targeter.Rd

For each explanatory variable, this function analyzes its relationship with a target variable by calculating statistics, WOE, IV, and other metrics.

Arguments

data

data.frame or data.table - Data to analyze

target

character - Name of the target variable to explain

description_data

character - Description of the dataset (optional)

target_type

character - Type of target: "autoguess" (default), "binary", "categorical", or "numeric"

target_reference_level

any - Reference level for binary/categorical targets (if NULL, will be inferred)

description_target

character - Description of the target variable (optional)

analysis_name

character - Name for the analysis (optional)

select_vars

character vector - Variables to include (if NULL, all columns are considered)

exclude_vars

character vector - Variables to exclude from analysis

nbins

integer - Number of bins for numeric variables (default: 12)

binning_method

character - Method for binning: "quantile" (default), "clustering", or "smart"

naming_conventions

logical - Whether to enforce naming conventions (default: FALSE)

useNA

character - How to handle NAs: "ifany" (default) or "no"

verbose

logical - Whether to print detailed progress information (default: FALSE)

dec

integer - Number of decimals for numeric display (default: 2)

order_label

character - Method for ordering labels in output (default: "auto")

cont_target_trim

numeric - Trimming factor for continuous targets, as percentage between 0 and 1 (default: 0.01)

bxp_factor

numeric - Factor for boxplot whiskers calculation (default: 1.5)

num_as_categorical_nval

integer - Threshold for treating numeric as categorical (default: 5)

autoguess_nrows

integer - Rows to use for variable type detection (default: 1000, 0 means all rows)

woe_alternate_version

character - When to use alternate WOE definition: "if_continuous" (default) or "always"

woe_shift

numeric - Shift value for WOE calculation to prevent issues with 0% or 100% classes (default: 0.01)

woe_post_cluster

logical - Whether to cluster WOE values (default: FALSE)

woe_post_cluster_n

integer - Number of clusters for WOE clustering (default: 6)

smart_quantile_by

numeric - Quantile step for smart binning (default: 0.01)

by_nvars

integer - Number of variables to process in each batch (default: 200)

debug

logical - Whether to print debug information (default: FALSE)

...

Additional parameters passed to targeter_internal

Value

An object of class "targeter" with detailed profiling information

See also

  • summary.targeter

  • plot.crossvar

  • summary.crossvar

  • report

Examples

targeter(adult,target ="ABOVE50K")
#> 
#> INFO:target ABOVE50K detected as type: binary
#> INFO:binary target contains number, automatic chosen level: 1; override using `target_reference_level`
#> $dataname
#> [1] "adult"
#> 
#> $target
#> [1] "ABOVE50K"
#> 
#> $description_data
#> [1] "adult"
#> 
#> $description_target
#> [1] "TargetABOVE50K [binary]"
#> 
#> $target_type
#> [1] "binary"
#> 
#> $target_stats
#>    value count   nNA percNA      perc
#>    <int> <int> <int>  <num>     <num>
#> 1:     0 24720     0      0 0.7591904
#> 2:     1  7841     0      0 0.2408096
#> 
#> $analysis_name
#> [1] "Analysis of  ABOVE50K on data: adult"
#> 
#> $date
#> [1] "2025-03-28"
#> 
#> $profiles
#>               profiles   
#> AGE           crossvar,17
#> FNLWGT        crossvar,17
#> EDUCATIONNUM  crossvar,17
#> HOURSPERWEEK  crossvar,17
#> WORKCLASS     crossvar,15
#> EDUCATION     crossvar,15
#> MARITALSTATUS crossvar,15
#> OCCUPATION    crossvar,15
#> RELATIONSHIP  crossvar,15
#> RACE          crossvar,15
#> SEX           crossvar,15
#> NATIVECOUNTRY crossvar,15
#> attr(,"names")
#>  [1] "AGE"           "FNLWGT"        "EDUCATIONNUM"  "HOURSPERWEEK" 
#>  [5] "WORKCLASS"     "EDUCATION"     "MARITALSTATUS" "OCCUPATION"   
#>  [9] "RELATIONSHIP"  "RACE"          "SEX"           "NATIVECOUNTRY"
#> 
#> $variables
#>          variable is_in_data is_target is_in_exclude    var_type
#>            <char>     <lgcl>    <lgcl>        <lgcl>      <char>
#>  1:      ABOVE50K       TRUE      TRUE         FALSE            
#>  2:           AGE       TRUE     FALSE         FALSE     numeric
#>  3:   CAPITALGAIN       TRUE     FALSE         FALSE     numeric
#>  4:   CAPITALLOSS       TRUE     FALSE         FALSE     numeric
#>  5:     EDUCATION       TRUE     FALSE         FALSE categorical
#>  6:  EDUCATIONNUM       TRUE     FALSE         FALSE     numeric
#>  7:        FNLWGT       TRUE     FALSE         FALSE     numeric
#>  8:  HOURSPERWEEK       TRUE     FALSE         FALSE     numeric
#>  9: MARITALSTATUS       TRUE     FALSE         FALSE categorical
#> 10: NATIVECOUNTRY       TRUE     FALSE         FALSE categorical
#> 11:    OCCUPATION       TRUE     FALSE         FALSE categorical
#> 12:          RACE       TRUE     FALSE         FALSE categorical
#> 13:  RELATIONSHIP       TRUE     FALSE         FALSE categorical
#> 14:           SEX       TRUE     FALSE         FALSE categorical
#> 15:     WORKCLASS       TRUE     FALSE         FALSE categorical
#>     dropped_one_single_value has_profile
#>                       <lgcl>      <lgcl>
#>  1:                       NA       FALSE
#>  2:                       NA        TRUE
#>  3:                     TRUE       FALSE
#>  4:                     TRUE       FALSE
#>  5:                       NA        TRUE

#>  7:                       NA        TRUE
#>  8:                       NA        TRUE
#>  9:                       NA        TRUE
#> 10:                       NA        TRUE
#> 11:                       NA        TRUE
#> 12:                       NA        TRUE
#> 13:                       NA        TRUE
#> 14:                       NA        TRUE
#> 15:                       NA        TRUE
#> 
#> $messages
#> $messages$INFO
#> [1] "target ABOVE50K detected as type: binary"
#> 
#> $messages$INFO
#> [1] "binary target contains number, automatic chosen level: 1; override using `target_reference_level`"
#> 
#> 
#> $session
#> $session$R_version
#> [1] "R version 4.4.3 (2025-02-28)"
#> 
#> $session$os
#> [1] "Ubuntu 24.04.2 LTS"
#> 
#> $session$targeter_package_version
#> [1] ‘1.6.0’
#> 
#> 
#> $target_reference_level
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "targeter" "list"
